inlineContent.text: TUIkit lets you build terminal applications using a familiar, declarative syntax inspired by SwiftUI. No ncurses, no C dependencies: pure Swift.
: 5 built-in phosphor themes with full RGB color support
: Configurable shortcut bar with context stack
: Pure Swift, no ncurses or other C libraries

abstract.text: A declarative, SwiftUI-like framework for building Terminal User Interfaces in Swift.
The base protocol for all TUIkit views.
The base protocol for scenes in TUIKit.
Defines the type of a row in a List, controlling selectability and focus behavior.
Built-in palette presets inspired by classic terminal phosphors.
Backwards-compatible type alias for
A padded, optionally titled container with background support.
A List row with type information for selection and focus handling.
The visual style of a spinner animation.
A view that displays no content.
A view that represents either the true or false branch of a conditional.
A value that describes the purpose of a button.
Build your first terminal application with TUIkit.
Navigate between interactive elements using the keyboard.
Combined alignment for both axes.
Understand how TUIkit turns your view tree into terminal output: one frame at a time.

Tracks focus state for a specific element.
A result builder that constructs arrays of buttons for use in

A list style that uses minimal visual styling with no borders or backgrounds.
A protocol for items that can be displayed in a status bar.

The selection mode for a list or table component.
The style of a text view.
A scrollable list with keyboard navigation and single selection.
Understand the two-pass layout used by stacks and other layout containers.
The visual style of a track-based control like ProgressView or Slider.
A modifier that strips all styling from content and replaces it with
a uniform dimmed appearance using only two colors.

make room when showing the leading column or columns.
The appearance and behavior of a toggle.
A modifier that disables selection for a view within a List.
A modal alert view that displays a title, message, and optional action buttons.

Pass data from child views up to their ancestors.

A list style that uses borders, inset padding, and section grouping with alternating row colors.
A two-way connection to a mutable value.
Defines the visual appearance and animation of the text cursor in text fields.
A modifier that presents content as a centered modal overlay when a binding is true.
The visibility of the leading columns in a navigation split view.
A scene that represents a single window (terminal).

Control border styles, visual appearances, and the color system.

Represents a frame dimension that can be a fixed value or infinity.

A column in a navigation split view.
Manage reactive state in your TUIkit application.
How much space a parent proposes to a child view.
A key for defining preference values that propagate up the view hierarchy.
Internal modifier that layers an overlay view on top of the base content.

A toggle style that displays a leading label and a trailing switch.
The edges of a view.

A set of vertical edges (top and/or bottom).
